Adenine

Apr 25, 2023 • Wenjian Liao, Zhizhong Lu

Rfam ID: RF00167 (Purine riboswitch)


横向排列的点击按钮

Click into different sections:

Timeline Description Structure&recognition References


Timeline

Start

    Discovery of the adenine riboswitch

    2004[3]

    Crystal structures of add adenine riboswitch bound to adenine

    2004[4]

    Crystal structures of the U65C mutant ydhL adenine riboswitch in ligand-free state

    2010[7]

    Four structures of the add adenine riboswitch during the course of a reaction were determined using femtosecond X-ray free electron laser (XFEL) pulses

    2017[8]
2023...


Description

Carrying an aptamer domain similar in sequence and secondary structure to the guanine riboswitch, the adenine riboswitch selectively recognizes adenine, and contains a uracil ribonucleotide in position 74 of the adenine-binding aptamer domain. B. subtilis ydhL (also called pbuE) and two RNAs (add genes) from Clostridium perfringens and Vibrio vulnificus harbor adenine riboswitches in their mRNA elements. The ydhL adenine riboswitch has been shown to control gene expression through transcriptional activation, while the add adenine riboswitch controls gene expression through translational activation[3-4].


Gene association

Purine salvage, interconversion, and catabolic pathways in B. subtilis. It has been demonstrated that the ydhL gene, encoding for the putative purine efflux pump, and the add gene, encoding for adenine deaminase[1-4].


Gene regulation

Mechanisms for regulation of gene expression by adenine riboswitches. The Shine-Dalgarno GAA sequence and the initiation codon are shaded in orange and blue respectively[3-4].


Structure and Ligand recognition

2D representation

Left: Consensus sequence and secondary structure model for the adenine riboswitch. Right: Secondary structure depictions of the adenine riboswitch according to PDB ID: 1Y26[4].


Document



3D visualisation

The overall structure of the adenine riboswitch was generated from PDB ID: 1Y26 at 2.10 Å resolution bound with adenine. Adenine (shown in sticks) is labeled in red [4].
PDBe Molstar






Binding pocket

Left: Surface representation of the binding pocket of the adenine riboswitch generated from PDB ID: 1Y26. Adenine (shown in sticks) is labeled in red. Right: The hydrogen bonds of the binding sites of the adenine riboswitch bound with adenine[4].


Ligand recognition

Chemical structures of adenine and its analogs. The apparent KD of each compound of the ydhL adenine riboswitch is shown on bottom[3].
